i1.name: Get Excited!
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Whenever an enemy {{tip|champion}} or epic {{tip|monster}} dies, or {{tip|turret}} or [[inhibitor]] is destroyed, within 3 seconds of being damaged by '''Jinx''', she gains {{sti|ms|{{as|175% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} which decays over 6 seconds.
Additionally, she gains {{sti|{{as|15% '''total''' attack speed}}}} and is allowed to exceed the {{tt|attack speed cap|normally 2.5 attacks per second}} for the same duration.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Whenever an enemy champion or epic monster dies, or turret or inhibitor is destroyed, within 3 seconds of being damaged by Jinx, she gains 175% bonus movement speed which decays over 6 seconds.
Additionally, she gains 15% total attack speed and is allowed to exceed the attack speed cap for the same duration.

w1.name: Zap!
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Jinx''' fires a shock blast in the target direction that deals {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy it hits and {{tip|sight|reveals}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} them for 2 seconds.
w1.descriptionHtml: Active: Jinx fires a shock blast in the target direction that deals physical damage to the first enemy it hits and reveals and slows them for 2 seconds.
w1.notes: * ''Zap!'' will fire from wherever '''Jinx''' was at the start of the cast time.

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 160% AD)

  • Slow: %

r1.name: Super Mega Death Rocket!
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Jinx''' fires a rocket in the target direction, granting brief {{tip|sight}} of the {{tt|area|Cannot grant sight into brush nor through terrain}} it flies through. The rocket explodes upon colliding with an enemy champion, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to them and all enemies in an {{tt|area|centered on the initial target}} around them and granting {{tip|sight}} of the {{tt|area|Can grant sight into brush and through terrain}} around them for 2 seconds.
The rocket deals {{pp|type=distance traveled|key=%|10 to 100 for 16|0 to 1500}} damage; the '''bonus''' damage based on {{as|'''missing''' health}} is kept the same.

Enemies surrounding the main target take 80% damage. '''Bonus''' damage based on {{as|'''missing''' health}} is based on each unit's own {{as|'''missing''' health}}, with a maximum '''bonus''' damage of 800 against {{tip|monsters}}.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Jinx fires a rocket in the target direction, granting brief sight of the area it flies through. The rocket explodes upon colliding with an enemy champion, dealing physical damage to them and all enemies in an area around them and granting sight of the area around them for 2 seconds.
The rocket deals 0 to 1500 â€’ undefined damage; the bonus damage based on missing health is kept the same.
Enemies surrounding the main target take 80% damage. Bonus damage based on missing health is based on each unit's own missing health, with a maximum bonus damage of 800 against monsters.
leveling: {{st|Maximum Physical Damage|{{ap|250 to 550}} {{as|(+ 150% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|25 to 35}}% of target's '''missing''' health)}}|Minimum Physical Damage|{{ap|(250 to 550)*0.1}} {{as|(+ {{ap|150*0.1}}% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|25 to 35}}% of target's '''missing''' health)}}}}

{{st|Maximum Secondary Damage|{{ap|(250 to 550)*0.8}} {{as|(+ {{ap|150*0.8}}% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|(25 to 35)*0.8}}% of target's '''missing''' health)}}|Minimum Secondary Damage|{{ap|(250 to 550)*0.8*0.1}} {{as|(+ {{ap|150*0.8*0.1}}% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|(25 to 35)*0.8}}% of target's '''missing''' health)}}}}
r1.notes:
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will not prevent the explosion.
* ''Super Mega Death Rocket'' will fire from wherever '''Jinx''' was at the start of the cast time.
* The minimap icon of ''Super Mega Death Rocket'' can be seen by '''Jinx''' and all her allies.
* Unlike similar spells, ''Super Mega Death Rocket'' will not increase it's damage when ranked up while the missile is in flight.{{bug|2}}
** This is because the base damage is fixed at a multiple of the damage the rocket initially started with.
** The {{as|'''bonus''' AD}} ratio will still update when {{as|AD}} is gained or lost between the cast and hit of the missile.
